> Darkhawk stubborly continue folliwing the spark extractor. while 
> Hydras slowly recovered

The hole that Darkhawk is moving through is barely large enough to accommodate him, even if he lays down and wriggles through it on his stomach. The hole is very narrow and yet for the moment very very straight. It is cutting through the soft earth of the surface, and it is obvious that if Darkhawk continues that he is risking being buried alive. 

The disk is no longer in sight, although from the sound of things it is still continuing  to make progress much further ahead. 

> Walking over to where the device was burrowing into the ground, Shard
> looked down the hole and then up at Hydras. 
>
> "Orders?"

(TAG: Hydras, Darkhawk, Shard)

OOC: I will let Hydras respond about the orders. Also Shard will not be able to see much down the hole with Darkhawk wriggling down. The hole looks perfectly straight as if cut with a razor . . . or a disintergration beam

Welcome back Shard!!!!!! I hope all is going well!! :)

Preston
